name: Give Me Another Letter Online Trivia | Alphabetics | 10 Questions

questions.text: What C is a fortified house or fortress, usually the medieval residences of European kings or nobles?
questions.explanation:
castle & castles.

	Castles evolved from a need for strategic fortresses that could accommodate several households and provide shelter in times of war.

questions.text: What H are the entitlements that an individual may arguably possess by virtue of being human and in accordance with what is natural?
questions.explanation:
Human Rights.

	The concept of the inalienable rights of the human being has traditionally been linked to the idea of natural law, on which important commentaries several Greek and Roman writers.

questions.text: What L is a Baltic republic in North East Europe, with Vilnius as its capital?
questions.explanation:
Lithuania.

	The first independent, unified Lithuanian state emerged in 1251, and by the 14th century had expanded east as far as Moscow. In 1386 Lithuania entered into a dynastic union with Poland.

questions.text: What O is the principal God in Norse mythology?
questions.correct: Odin & Oden & Odan & Wodan & Wodin & Woden
questions.explanation:
Odin & Oden & Odan & Wodan & Wodin & Woden.

	Identified with the Teutonic God Woden, he is considered to be the God of wisdom, culture, war and death. He lived with the Valkyries in Valhalla, where he received the souls of dead warriors.

questions.text: What P, in mathematics, is a solid geometrical figure whose ends are congruent, most commonly triangles, and perpendicular to the length, with the other faces rectangles?
questions.explanation:
Prism.

	The volume of a prism is equal to the area of the end mutiplied by the length of the prism.

questions.text: What S is a geological fault line extending more than 600 miles through California?
questions.explanation:
San Andreas Fault.

	It lies on the boundary between the North American and the Pacific plates of the earth's crust.

questions.text: What T is any of numerous species of tail-less amphibians that move with a crawling or hopping gait?
questions.explanation:
Toad & Toads.

	Toads are indigenous throughout the world, except Australasia where they were introduced to combat certain types of pests, but have since become pests themselves.

questions.text: What M is an element that is a good conductor of heat and electricity, and whose atoms are bonded together within crystals in a unique way?
questions.explanation:
Metal.

	About three quarters of known elements are metals. Most are hard, shiny materials that form oxides.

questions.text: What H is the British theoretical physicist who wrote 'A Brief History of Time'?
questions.explanation:
Stephen Hawking.

	Hawking supported the 'Big Bang' theory of the origin of the Universe and did much pioneering work on the theory of Black Holes.

questions.text: What D is the spreading of a wave, such as a light beam, on passing through a narrow opening or hitting the edge of an obstacle?
questions.explanation:
Diffraction.

	It is evidence for the wave nature of light. Diffraction provides information on the wavelength of light and the structure of crystals. All waves are diffracted by obstacles.
